page.title: 07SOLTON MANOR FARM
page.content: The farm is mentioned in the original Survey of 1086 where it is called Soltone but the settlement predates this. The name derives from the Saxon for "Muddy pool farmstead". Situated in a hollow in the chalk a dew pond was the possible reason for the collection of water. Today it is no longer family owned as most farms in the area are but by a combined based in Folkestone. Originally a mixed farm with cattle,sheep and cereals it has changed to producing mainly oil seed rape,with some livestock. This is undoubtedly due to the large subsidy that the E.E.C. place on the crop. The whole area is now yellow with the flowers in the early summer. A highly mechanised farm the farm manager no longer lives in the farmhouse which has been sold for private occupation.
